title: An Aimsir Chaite (The Past Tense)
excerpt: In Irish, the past tense, or 'Aimsir Chaite,' reflects actions that have already occurred.

title: An Aimsir Láithreach (The Present Tense)
excerpt: In Irish, the present tense, or 'Aimsir Láithreach,' reflects actions that are in the process of occuring.

title: An Aimsir Fháistineach (The Future Tense)
excerpt: Looking ahead, the future tense in Irish, known as 'Aimsir Fháistineach,' allows us to express actions that are yet to happen.

title: An Séimhiú agus an t-urú (Lenition and Eclipsis)
excerpt: Séimhiú, or lenition, is the softening of a consonant sound, typically indicated by adding an 'h' after the initial consonant. On the other hand, t-urú, or eclipsis, involves the initial consonant of a word being replaced or eclipsed by another consonant sound.

title: An Modh Coinníollach (The Conditional Tense)
excerpt: Modh Coinníollach (Conditional Tense) is a verb form in Irish that expresses actions or events that may happen or are dependent on certain conditions.

title: An Aidiacht Shealbhach (Possesive Adjectives)
excerpt: The Aidiacht shealbhach in Irish, also known as the possessive adjective, is a word that shows ownership or possession. It's like saying my, your, his, her, our, or their in English.

title: Caol agus Leathan (Slender and Broad)
excerpt: Here, you will learn a way to group Irish verbs based on it's last vowel

title: Na Briathra neamhrialta (Irregular Verbs)
excerpt: There are 11 irregular verbs to remember in Irish, which change the root depending on the tense.

title: Na Daitheanna (The Colours)
excerpt: A short list of 24 colours/colour related words in Irish.

title: Briathair (Verbs)
excerpt: A list of 57 verb roots in Irish.

title: Na Contaetha (The Counties)
excerpt: A list of all 32 counties in Irish.

title: An Aidiachhtaí (The Adjectives)
excerpt: A short list of 32 important adjectives in Irish.

title: Negative Numbers
excerpt: Negative numbers are numbers that are smaller than 0

title: Powers and Roots
excerpt: Powers are a way to write repeated multiplications, and roots are numbers that have a square that is equal to the number

title: Algebraic Equations
excerpt: Algebraic Equations are equations that have letters in them, like a + 12, 10 × b, or x + y + z.

title: Factorising and Expanding brackets
excerpt: Expanding brackets involves multiplying every term inside the bracket by the term that is outside of the bracket. Factorising is the opposite of expanding brackets.

title: Trigonometric ratios
excerpt: Trigonometric ratios are the ratios of the lengths of sides of a right-angled triangle.

title: Sets
excerpt: A set is a collection of things. The “things” that make up a set is called an element.

title: Functions
excerpt: A function is a relationship between numbers, where if one number is changed, another will change alongside it.

title: The Historian
excerpt: Learn the basic key words that are used by Historians

title: The Archaeologist
excerpt: Learn the basic key words that are used by Archaeologists

title: Early Christian Ireland
excerpt: Early Christian Ireland was the period when Christianity first came to Ireland from a bishop named Palladius

title: Ancient Ireland
excerpt: The stone, (Mesolithic and Neolithic periods) and bronze age are the prehistoric (before recorded history) eras of Ireland.

title: Ancient Rome
excerpt: Rome was the most powerful empire in the ancient world

title: Life and Death in the medieval times
excerpt: People lived in a feudal system in the Middle Ages, meaning that the social hierarchy was very strict with most of the population being peasants.

title: Medieval Ireland
excerpt: The Middle Ages in Ireland had a lot of conflict, as the Vikings and the Normans came into Ireland and had a huge impact.

title: The Rennaisance
excerpt: The renaissance was a Golden age in History that started in Italy.

title: Measurement
excerpt: All scientists use the international system of measurement, SI, also known as the metric system.

title: Density
excerpt: Density is the mass per unit volume (Amount of mass that is condensed in an area of space)

title: Motion
excerpt: Speed is the rate in which an object is moving.

title: Force
excerpt: Force is the push or pull on an object with mass, which causes it to change its velocity.

title: Energy
excerpt: Work measures the energy transfer that happens when an object is moved with a force, and it is measured in Joules (J).

title: Electricity
excerpt: Electricity is the result of the movement of electrons, which have a negative charge.

title: Le Passé composé with avoir
excerpt: Le passé composé is a past tense to describe once off completed actions in the past.

title: Le Passé composé with Être
excerpt: Le passé composé is a past tense to describe once off completed actions in the past. Although the majority is conjugated in avoir, some are conjugated with Être.

title: Comparatif
excerpt: In English we have two ways of comparing things whereas in French we have 1.
author: Zayon Khaleik

title: Demonstrative Adjectives
excerpt: Demonstrative adjectives:  this/that/these/those

title: Futur Simple
excerpt: The futur simple is a tense used to describe actions that will happen in the future

title: Le Futur Proche (Immediate future)
excerpt: To form the futur proche, you musy join the present tense of aller with the infinitive form of the verb.
author: Zayon Khaleik

title: L’imparfait  (imperfect)
excerpt: The imperfect is a past tense in French. It is used to describe 5 different types of things.
